| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [monst.c#line2120](/wiki/Monst.c#line2120 "Monst.c") |

A **gnome zombie**, Z, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [zombified](/wiki/Zombie "Zombie") [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)") that is the second weakest [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)") after the [kobold zombie](/wiki/Kobold_zombie "Kobold zombie"), and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Gnome zombies can [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") [you](/wiki/You "You") to other levels if they are adjacent.

A gnome zombie has a single claw attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated gnome zombies are always hostile.

Gnome zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Priest quest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest"). The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include gnome zombies among their ranks.

A gnome zombie will leave an aged [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.[\[1\]](#cite_note-undead_to_corpse-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-make_corpse-2)

## Strategy

Gnome zombies are barely stronger than kobold zombies and noticeably weaker than live [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)"). Most roles can handle gnome zombies with the same ease as kobold zombies, and neutral [protection racketeers](/wiki/Protection_racket "Protection racket") can benefit from killing one to gain [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") and [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") access - unlike kobold zombies, they also give a fair bit of [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience") that may make it more difficult to maneuver around minimizing their [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level").

## History

The gnome zombie first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), gnome zombies can be created by using the [raise zombies](/wiki/Raise_zombies "Raise zombies") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") while adjacent to the corpse of any [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)").

Player [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") and [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") entering the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") will encounter gnome zombies in place of normal gnomes.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), gnome zombies are replaced with the [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(GruntHack\) "Zombie (GruntHack)") [racial monster](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster"), which gnomes are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead gnome monster killed by a zombie will rise as a gnome zombie.

## Encyclopedia entry

The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.

\[ W. B. Seabrook ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-undead_to_corpse_1-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L147): *Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-make_corpse_2-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L372): *Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [sp\_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/sp_lev.c#line854 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/sp lev.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Gnome zombie

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Z gnome zombie
Difficulty 2
Attacks Claw 1d5
Z gnome zombie
Difficulty 2
Attacks

Claw 1d5

Base level 1
Base experience 8
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -2 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 650
Nutritional value 50
Size Small
Resistances Cold, sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed None

A gnome zombie:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is a gnome.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • has infravision.
  • can leave an old gnome corpse.
Reference monst.c#line2120

A gnome zombie, Z, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a zombified gnome that is the second weakest zombie after the kobold zombie, and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Gnome zombies can follow you to other levels if they are adjacent.

A gnome zombie has a single claw attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 GruntHack
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated gnome zombies are always hostile.

Gnome zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for Priests, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Priest quest. The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include gnome zombies among their ranks.

A gnome zombie will leave an aged gnome corpse upon death.[1][2]

Strategy

Gnome zombies are barely stronger than kobold zombies and noticeably weaker than live gnomes. Most roles can handle gnome zombies with the same ease as kobold zombies, and neutral protection racketeers can benefit from killing one to gain alignment record and prayer access - unlike kobold zombies, they also give a fair bit of experience that may make it more difficult to maneuver around minimizing their experience level.

History

The gnome zombie first appears in NetHack 3.0.0, where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, gnome zombies can be created by using the raise zombies technique while adjacent to the corpse of any gnome.

Player gnomes and dwarves entering the Gnomish Mines will encounter gnome zombies in place of normal gnomes.[3]

GruntHack

In GruntHack, gnome zombies are replaced with the zombie racial monster, which gnomes are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead gnome monster killed by a zombie will rise as a gnome zombie.

Encyclopedia entry

The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.

[ W. B. Seabrook ]

References

  1. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147: Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts
  2. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372: Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops
  3. ↑ sp_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854

A '''gnome zombie''', {{monsym|gnome zombie}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[Zombie|zombified]] [[Gnome (monster attribute)|gnome]] that is the second weakest [[Zombie (monster class)|zombie]] after the [[kobold zombie]], and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Gnome zombies can [[follow]] [[you]] to other levels if they are adjacent.

A gnome zombie has a single claw attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated gnome zombies are always hostile.

Gnome zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Priest]]s, and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Priest quest]]. The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include gnome zombies among their ranks.

A gnome zombie will leave an aged [[Gnome (monster)|gnome]] [[corpse]] upon death.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|147|nethack=3.6.7|name="undead_to_corpse"|comment=Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts}}{{refsrc|src/mon.c|372|nethack=3.6.7|name="make_corpse"|comment=Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops}}

==Strategy==
Gnome zombies are barely stronger than kobold zombies and noticeably weaker than live [[Gnome (monster class)|gnomes]]. Most roles can handle gnome zombies with the same ease as kobold zombies, and neutral [[protection racket]]eers can benefit from killing one to gain [[alignment record]] and [[prayer]] access - unlike kobold zombies, they also give a fair bit of [[experience]] that may make it more difficult to maneuver around minimizing their [[experience level]].

==History==
The gnome zombie first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], gnome zombies can be created by using the [[raise zombies]] [[technique]] while adjacent to the corpse of any [[Gnome (monster attribute)|gnome]].

Player [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomes]] and [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarves]] entering the [[Gnomish Mines]] will encounter gnome zombies in place of normal gnomes.{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|854|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], gnome zombies are replaced with the [[Zombie (GruntHack)|zombie]] [[racial monster]], which gnomes are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead gnome monster killed by a zombie will rise as a gnome zombie.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.
|[ W. B. Seabrook ]
}}
